comment_Text: I have loved this app, and I do pay for the subscription. In recent months, there have been quite a few glitches recording my heart rate and syncing from my watch as well as syncing activities from Google Fit. I contacted Support, and while they provided various suggestions, all of which I tried, the excuse is now the "third-party apps." Sorry, I expect more from a paid app, and if you can't deliver what you advertise, then don't charge for it.

I just downloaded the app 1 hour ago and signed up for the yearly subscription. I tried getting on the app on my phone, and I got the following error: There was an error starting Cardiogram. I closed and re- opened the app numerous times. I read through the reviews and found that most people were having the same problem. I made the mistake of not reading the reviews before downloading and signing up for the yearly subscription.

Stopped logging heart rate. Up until recently the app stopped charting your daily heart rate. Now it just shows it blank where it would previously show it on the daily graph. It shows the data above it like resting HR and such but not on the chart/graph. On my watch in the cardiogram app it shows the heart rate. All permissions are correct. I sent an email about it on the contact us page but just an auto reply was received.

I paid for the annual subscription during their flash sale in December. The features lasted maybe a month, then disappeared. I tried to contact their support and have heard nothing back since I sent the request two weeks ago. If you use this app, never upgrade, you won't get any of the extra features they advertise and no one will help if you have issues.

Not that useful if you already use a health monitoring app. It takes a while for the data to load, whereas I can see it all automatically on my Fitbit app. Also, it doesn't load all the data from my Fitbit watch & app, like sleep data. And I didn't even try to plug my birthdate in because it wants you to scroll back one month at a time from today!!! Why wouldn't they make an option to just TYPE it in?! Not very functional & very redundant.
Reply Content: We've taken your advice to heart and replaced the date picker! We'd also love to hear about what you were hoping to see in Cardiogram, and how we can make the app more useful for you: you can contact me personally at song@cardiogr.am

comment_Text: During the installation process, I sync'd with my WearOS watch, then the app on the phone wouldn't progress past a screen that demanded that I subscribe to one of two options via an in-app purchase, even though I clicked the "Try for Free" button on the preceding screen. I wasn't able to use the app at all, so I killed it and removed it. Seems like false advertising.
Reply Content: Hi Keith! You don't need a subscription to use our app - tapping the X in the top right corner should take you to the app proper (the 'Try for Free' button actually refers to trying Cardiogram Premium; I can definitely see how that can be misleading). We hope you'll give Cardiogram another try but understand if you'd rather not. Stay safe! ^Linda

comment_Text: Just.... No. Installed it on my watch, installed it on my phone, tried to sync them. The minute you hit decline on the "give me money now" page it dumps you back to the sign up page. I even tried to log in thinking maybe it was done. But nope. There is no x to close out of it. You hit decline, and it completely deletes any progress you've made towards signing up. Will be deleting the app off of both devices and never downloading again
Reply Content: Thank you for taking some time to leave a review. That is correct; to access the app's features you must sign up for a subscription. You can test drive the app free for 30 days. If you cancel before the end of the trial, you will not be charged.

comment_Text: I contacted their support the day I signed up for the premium trial and never heard back. Now that the trial is over and I'm signed up for a full year, the app is even less functional. It will not sync with my fitbit. I can't get up to date information. And clicking on any of the "premium" features simply pulls up a popup message asking if I want to sign up for the premium version. I AM SIGNED UP FOR THE PREMIUM VERSION. And I STILL haven't heard back from your support team.
Reply Content: Hi Catherine - I'm really sorry about your bad experiences. Fitbit mistakenly turned off our access, but this is now fixed. I've also fixed your issue with locked Premium featuresâ€”you were mistakenly added to a small test we ran, but now you should be able to access all Premium features in the "Premium" pane of the app.

comment_Text: Every time I try to update to the Premium Package at the current sale price, the app won't let me. I get a message: ERROR Your order is processing, your item will be available in a few minutes. When I hit OK it says "An error occurred please try again. I've tried 6 times and the same thing. The only reason I wanted this app is for the premium package. I had gone thru the whole order before and entered my credit card etc. but nothing showed on the account and the premium package wasn't activated. WHAT'S UP??? I'd rate my experience with 0 stars if that was an option. It looks like they don't want my money.
Reply Content: Sorry to hear that Maureen! Could you email me at song@cardiogr.am with your account details, like the email you're using to sign in? We'd love the opportunity to help sort things out!

comment_Text: Second review - The cardiogram began working again as it should. It lasted for 6 days this time. last night it stopped monitoring my rate every 3 minutes as scheduled, did not record my rate on the graph, or monitor my sleep. It isn't the watch. It's this app. It is inconsistent and not reliable. I have tried resetting the app, unfortunately that wasn't helpful either. You do not need a premium account in order for this to function properly. Please advise on how this issue can be fixed.
Reply Content: Hi Rebecca, thanks for leaving us your feedback. I'm sorry you've had a rough experience -- that's definitely not how we want the app to work! There's a tight character limit on my reply, so I can't troubleshoot everything here, but if you send me an email at hello@cardiogr.am I'll look into the problem for you. Hoping to resolve it ASAP! - Pax

comment_Text: Worked great up until 2 days ago. Timeline won't show any new graphs beyond 2 days ago. Was this a free trial type app? Update- It had now been a week and the app still won't work. I can still get current HR through the companion app on the watch, but the phone app will not show that it is connected or getting data. I've uninstalled and reinstalled the app, but nothing is working. i really liked this app for the few days it worked. Oh well.

Are you using the same Google account on your phone and watch? If it's still not working, describe what you're seeing in more detail or email us at hello@cardiogr.am!

comment_Text: I tried setting up an account. Reply Content: Thank you for giving us a try. While it's not a required app we would love to have you as a user. We recently made a change to make Cardiogram a subscription-only service with a 30-day free trial for new users. The app must be free to download to allow users a free trial. However, you can cancel free of charge up to 30 days!

comment_Text: I can't even use the app, it prompts me to sign up for an annual subscription. When I decline, it logs me out. It will not let me get past the login screen.
Reply Content: Correct you won't be able to access the app unless you have an active subscription. Now, if you have an active subscription but can't get in, that is another thing. If you send us an email we can do some investigating feel free to email hello@cardiogram.com to ask for Kevin and I'll see what we can do.

comment_Text: Worked great year one. Since August 2023, App does not track unless manually pushed to do so and only records for that moment. Customer service tried to help, but un successful. Re-installed, restarted, etc., etc., All settings checked for correctness per cardiogram instructions. All good there. Still no auto record...

Used to be free, then offer basic being able to view heart rate, now only options are paid. Can't even get passed the subscription page to view past results. Also says on the subscribe page free trial then when you click on it it doesn't say anything about a trial, so taking a risk pressing the button. Very disappointing.
Reply Content: Our goal is to make heart health monitoring accessible and insightful for everyone. The subscription model supports us in maintaining the app, providing regular updates, and adding new features that our users request. We have fixed the bug where it was not giving out trials as advertised. If you have trouble, please send us an email. - Kevin

comment_Text: Despite paying for the subscription I am locked out. I've been using this app for over a year. It has recently become very inaccurate. Definitely not a service I feel is worth paying for. I've waited 6 months for a doctor's appointment with a socialist who agreed to see me on a weekend. I wasn't able to show him ANY of my data yesterday and wasted $400 to see him, because a glitch in this app that wanted me to pay AGAIN to access my data. There are much better alternatives to use.
Reply Content: April, this isn't an experience I would want for anyone. While we're not designed to replace professional medical care, we want to ensure that your data is as accurate as possible and accessible when you need it. I don't want you to pay for a subscription if it's not working. Can you send me a message at hello@cardiogram.com - Kevin

comment_Text: Became a give me the money app and a useless app. Lost all of my progress of 2 years and insistently kept bringing me back to the sign up page if I declined a subscription. No thanks. comment_Text: Completely logs you out if you don't pay. Lake another viewer said, as soon as you click that you don't want to pay now, it logs you out. No pass go, no message, no nada. Cardiogram has offered free heart rate monitoring for many, many years, due to increased costs to maintain the app and introduce new features, we've had to switch to a subscription-based model. comment_Text: Phew. - Instantly tries to connect to Facebook on first startup (edit for clarification: that's a network connection, not an account connection) - Account creation mandatory (already bad practice for health-related apps) - Account creation *only* possible via Google account (even worse) So yeah, three red flags before I even get to see the app in action? Reply Content: Hi Sven, thanks for your feedback. You do not need to connect your FB account to use Cardiogram. However, you're right that we require an account, and on Android it needs to be set up via Google account to comply with regulations about integrating our app with other health apps. If you have questions, you can reach us at hello@cardiogram.com!

comment_Text: Get ready to receive email spam, Even if you never opted in, and even if you haven't used the app in years. I used this app a long time ago when it would simply measure your heart rate, eventually they added features for storing your previous heart rates in their cloud service, then they added a whole bunch of extra features that probably only serve to harvest your information. I stopped using it, and now more than 5 years later, they are sending me spam for their subscription "service".
Nonexistent, that's the only way to describe my experience. Nothing happened, download it to the phone and watch. Did not get further than that.

As many others have said, will randomly check your heat rate as and when it feels like it, sometimes it'll work fine for a few hours and then it'll miss a few hours after that before it starts checking again. UI is hard to use and very fiddly. I subscribed to the 7 hour sleep 'Habit' but it never knows when I'm asleep or not and you can't seem to manually trigger it.

I signed up to premium free trial. All I wanted it to do was to alert me if my heartbeat went above or below a certain number. Heart rate stayed on the same number even though I kept pressing the synchronise button. The heart rate on the watch changed as I moved around but stayed the same constantly on the app. It never achieved anything I want to do do. Cancelling trial. It's a shame because I would have been a paying member if it had worked.
Pay only, and they bait you into an account and your info before they tell you. Also way too expensive even if I would consider paying money for this.
Reply Content: Hi Cwissy, thanks for leaving a review. Cardiogram is a subscription-only app, but if you're downloading it for the first time, you should not be charged immediately as we offer all new users a 30-day free trial. If you have any questions, you can reach us at hello@cardiogram.com!

However, you may need a subscription now to access that profile. We're happy to investigate this and find out why you're getting those errors though. Can you send us a message to hello@cardiogram.com?

comment_Text: Paid money but didn't get more or different information for a year, then they want me to pay again. Nothing changed they just want more money. Before I paid there were info 'cards' never saw one after I paid. Total SCAM! Everyone should get their money back!!!! Just read in review response they put some people that paid into special test groups that didn't get all the features.
Reply Content: Hi Jessica. Thank you for taking some time to leave some feedback. We do require all users to purchase a subscription to access the app. If you've already paid though for a subscription, we don't want you to pay again. Can you send us a message to hello@cardiogram.com so we can have this investigated for you?

comment_Text: it offers subscription therefore it should be punctual, highly configurable with a lot function and clear interface and it is NOT, not even close. I have to say somehow it's successfully built against itself since watch version is syncing heart rate to other apps just fine so it's not wearable issue and same data won't show up on this corresponding app what is ridiculous. A lot of things missed on this app for sure and it's so silly to coming up with subscription with an app like this.

Having the same problem as everyone else, I go to sign up and get through everything and as soon as I decline paying for it, it takes me right back to the home page to start all over again. Very disappointing as this app comes on my watch free, as it should with how expensive the watch was! Oh well I guess.
Reply Content: We recently made a change to make Cardiogram a subscription-only service with a 30-day free trial for new users. The app must be free to download to allow users a free trial. However, you can cancel free of charge up to 30 days!

comment_Text: Was good until it wasn't bad customer service. I used this app daily as I have heart issues however paying for premium I was very disappointed when all of a sudden there was an error and it wouldn't work customer service had me delete/ reload/ resync as if I hadn't already tried that nothing worked. Then they said they would have tech ppl look at it. 2 weeks later I emailed again to be told there was no update...now its been over 5 months I've emailed several times with no reply.
Reply Content: Hi Amy! I do remember working with you from support and engineering on this. Like I said before, it's not the experience we want for you, even if it's isolated to just your profile. I did issue a refund back in October when we talked, as I don't want you to pay for something you can't use. I'll continue to ask engineering to work on this.

comment_Text: Worked great for about 2 days. Very useful info, great idea, but it crashed yesterday, and I can't get it to even open now. I had to open my Garmin connect almost every time I opened those app, to resync my data. I was only trialing it, but I hope I didn't sign up for open join, because now I can't even get into the app to opt out! ðŸ¤”
Reply Content: Hello Bill. Just wanted to give you an update. We apologize for the error. The issue has been fixed as of this morning. Can you please uninstall Cardiogram temporarily and reinstall it to apply the fix? If you continue to run into the issue please reach out to us at hello@cardiogram.am

comment_Text: Misleading app. The report scores me a 0.8. Doctor shows otherwise... Also the fact that this app uses your heart data to feed their databases but at the same time will keep your data history behind a paywall is predatory. It is your data, but you cannot check more than a few days before you get prompted for the "cloud" storage. One would think they would solve it by storing that data in your device, right? Uninstall this. Useless without expensive subscription.
Reply Content: Hi Fernando, I'm sorry you haven't been satisfied with Cardiogram. If you have questions about the report card, you can email us at hello@cardiogr.am and we'll look into your score personally. Device data storage is unfortunately not accessible to apps, which is why we store data on our servers. I'm happy to explain over email if you'd like! - Pax

comment_Text: When it comes to apps, nothing pisses me off more than developers advertising something as free when it's completely unusable without a subscription. Not once has that ploy ever convinced me to pay for an app. Even if there's a free trial, I immediately uninstall. If you want people to pay for your app, than advertise it that way instead of intentionally misleading people. You're only limiting the number of people willing to pay for it. Such a shame, uninstalled.
Reply Content: Hi Lauren. Thank you for the candid feedback I'll forward this to our leadership team. We recently changed Cardiogram to a subscription-only service with a 30-day free trial for new users. To give users a free trial, the app must be free to download. This information is in the app description before downloading.

comment_Text: Completely useless! Installed it since i read an article when it started syncing with Fitbit and promised more insights. Even after weeks of syncing it doesn't give me details, says it needs a few days of data. Then i noticed my synced step count is completely off too, so I uninstall it... Update: seems to be borderline a scam: got a mail after years saying my heart health report is ready. I didn't have the app installed, so got it and nothing there. Had to setup and all! Really fishy!
Reply Content: Hi AndrÃ©, thanks for sharing your feedback. I'm sorry that you received an email when you didn't expect it. If you send us an email at hello@cardiogram.com, we can investigate why you received this email despite no longer having an active account. We never want to spam users with irrelevant information; fixing this is important to us!

comment_Text: App on google watch notifies me to open it on my phone. I tap the notification to open on phone. Phone tries to open a url that is either broken or gone. So I search for the phone app. Got here to find a lot of complaints, and that the app doesn't do anything useful that I don't already get free from fitbit, and that the app can't even do what I expected. Don't know how this could have ended up as an app recommendation from Google for their new watch.
Reply Content: Hi Ken. Thanks for the review. I don't think I've actually seen this yet or understand what is happening, but if it's related to the new Pixel Watch and us (Cardiogram) it might be something we need to look into or speak to Google about if it's not guiding you to the right place. Do you mind sending us details about this hello@cardiogram.com?

comment_Text: One more trial but still same old problem! Not improved and your last reply didn't help! Review of May 30, 2019: Not accurate and unreliable! Installed in an Android Wear (TicWatch S) and smartphone. Nice interface with heartbeat tracking. With Google Fit installed but no way to get sleep tracking. My Peak BMP you recorded is 140! Everyday the same 140! Fitbit surge reported it from 99 to 124 over the same 4 days. For Resting BMP you recorded 75-84 while Fitbit 63-64.
Reply Content:
Contact us at hello@cardiogr.am with your account email, we can try to help!

In general, we get sleep data from Google Fit to show you your heart rate overlaid with your sleep time. You may need to use another app, like Sleep as Android, to write the sleep times! Can you confirm seeing existing sleep sessions in your Google Fit (Journal section)?

comment_Text: While trying to set up the app, a screen popped up asking to subscribe. The screen 'has' a cancel button but it did not work. It just flashed when pressed. Then I could not back out of the pop up. The only option was to accept. Nope. I forced it closed then uninstalled immediately off phone and watch.
Reply Content: Hi Michael. Thank you for giving us a try and for the review. You can only access the app features if you have a subscription. If you do not agree to purchase a subscription, you cannot access the app and be brought back to the login screen. This is also in the app description before you decide to download the app.

comment_Text: Deceitful developer. As others have noted, the developer hooks you into this from an app preinstalled (on my Samsung Watch 5 that I just purchased). Unless you pay right after installing it, you're thrown out. There is no free trial period as the developer claims in replies to comments here. Nor is this true that it "doesnt come preloaded" as claimed in a reply posted in March. Do not support scamming developers. I am sure there is a better app from an honest developer.

The app has not connected to Fitbit since last week. Unfortunately, this was not the first time that the connection to Fitbit broke, the previous time lasting about 2 weeks. Unfortunately, upgrading to Premium only guarantees responses to support requests with 4 business days. This is Premium service? I want to like this app, but it's too problematic and lacking adequate support response.
Reply Content: Hi Dan - really sorry about your bad experience with Fitbit syncingâ€”totally understand your frustration. Fitbit mistakenly turned off our data access and we had to slowly refresh old data. Should be updated now. We're setting up systems to prevent this and address it much faster if it does happen.

comment_Text: Does not work on Ticwatch Pro. App opens, asks for permission to sensor, grant permission, starts to scan. Crashes out with Sensor Error - contact us at... ironically the email address is cut off, can't even send that. Shame, this is a great app on Apple Watch - but no joy on Wear.  -update:  Got it installed and running but no way for me to sync it to Google Fit records. I am on IOS and the IOS Cardiogram app doesn't see the Wear OS watch (Ticwatch Pro). So - it's still useless. If you have ways to integrate it that I missed  out on - please do share.
Reply Content: Thanks for letting us know, we temporarily had an outage, but it should have been fixed within a day -  let us know if you're still having issues!

comment_Text: feels like whole app is designed for data gathering and not functionality for the end user. Doesn't automatically set timezone so all my workouts appeared in middle of the night. Is invasive and attempts to *label* absolutely everything including sex. Graphs are waaay too small and fiddly to see easily, pinch zoom, pinch zoom ... yawn!! ðŸ˜´ðŸ¥´ðŸ˜µ "maybe" useful if you have a condition that needs medical 24hr monitoring but for fitness or general use forget it. uninstalled.
Reply Content: Hi there, I'm sorry to hear that you had such a negative experience. Cardiogram isn't primarily a fitness app, it's a heart-rate based journal companion that provides insights into users' heart health (and it's totally fair if that's not what you're looking for!) If you ever try it again, I'd be happy to help you update your time zone. ^Linda

comment_Text: I got a notification today that my heart rate was below 40. I looked at it was a random blip in the middle of high 60s/low 70s. This happened the other day when I took off my watch and it said 32 but I never got a notification. I've been trying to communicate with support about the glitches I've had. And they no longer respond. So support is out the window. I'm trying to find out if these blips of random lows or highs could be because of the reader or if cardiogram glitches at all.
Reply Content: Hi Baylee, I'm not seeing an email from you in our support inbox. Would you mind emailing again with the subject line 'Review'? The short answer is that if you're seeing these low readings in your wearable's watch app (e.g., Garmin Connect) then it's probably an issue with your watch; if not, it's probably an issue with Cardiogram. ^Linda

comment_Text: Does not collect the correct data from the Fitbit app. So data accuracy is a big question mark as far as this app is concern. And the bigger concern is that this inaccurate data is going to be used for research. My suggestion to all is that if you feel data points are incorrect by cardiogram app then disconnect you fitnesss app and uninstall the app.
Reply Content: UPDATE: Fitbit syncing should be fixed! Contact me at song@cardiogr.am with your account email and device setup if it's still not working for you.

comment_Text: Do not buy premium. Do not download unless you are using the basic functions of this app ,that still messes up your data every month or two. Customer support is a joke, I'll show you the emails. Also, I'm a paid premium member with an ad on my main screen right at the top that is for a promotion that is expired. They don't know how to take off their expired ads on their own app. That right there should say it all. Great app ruined by greed. I paid for the year, don't be like me.
Reply Content: Hi Bruce. Thanks for reaching out to us through your review. We have received your email and are continuing to investigate this issue. The engineering team believes they have located the issue but still need more time to issue a fix. Thank you for your patience. When you have a free moment please reply to the email the support team has sent.

comment_Text: Metrics shows I'm doing well and claims I'm better than half the users with the stats provided. Moving over to the report tab, I am appearently in bad health? Yeah, okay; far from it. Not a useful app if its gonna lie. I question about the data it collects as well, always trying to get something from its user. Syncing with connect never happens on its own either. Try for free? Lol, doesn't let you.

Loved it until recently. October 29 was the last time it actually worked. I open the app and although all permissions were given, there are only a few measurements. I've uninstalled and reinstalled several times. I now have to search for an alternative app to track this very important metric.
Reply Content: We have not had this issue reported to us before, and we'd certainly like to work this through for you. Could you share the details at hello@cardiogr.am? And any relevant screenshots would be immensely valuable. Thank you.

comment_Text: Had this app on my phone for a while, gave permissions for Fitbit access. Absolutely nothing recorded. Cardiogram may be reaping my data, but I am getting nothing in return. My advice is to revoke cardiogram fitbit access via the fitbit web page if you are not getting added value from the web to stop them reaping your data.

At first it looks great but as it can't send data to Google fit and for some reason it doesn't seem to record above 110bpm it's just no use to me. Using a TicWatch Pro and it doesn't have any problem getting regular readings but not going over 110 is a large issue when other heart rate apps don't have this problem for me.
Reply Content: Hi, thanks for your feedback! We're working on writing data to Google Fit. Good news: Google's planning updates that'll make it easier to do so. Bad news: it's unclear when they'll be released. The 110 bpm "cap" is a known issue with TicWatch software. If you email hello@cardiogr.am I can share more info (there's a 350 character limit here)! - Pax

comment_Text: It worked for a couple of months, and then all of a sudden, when I try to open it, it says "There was an error opening Cardiogram. Please try closing and re-opening the app." I have tried closing and re-opening numerous times, clearing the cache, uninstalling and reinstalling, restarting the phone, but nothing has worked.
Reply Content: Hello Yoon. Providing you with an update. We apologize for the error. The issue has been fixed this morning. Can you please uninstall Cardiogram temporarily and reinstall it to apply the fix? If you continue to run into the issue please reach out to us at hello@cardiogram.am

comment_Text: As many other users said, this could be a very good app if it would work properly. Even though I set it to measure my HR every 5 minute, usually it measures only a few times a day (or at least it syncs with my OnePlus 7T Pro this many measurements). Having only 4-5 measurement for most days, it is completely useless to use it and drain your smartwatch's battery.
Reply Content: Hi Martin, I'm sorry to hear that you've had such a bad experience. Can I ask what wearable you are using to help me diagnose the issue? You can reach me at linda@cardiogr.am. We've also recently hired a dedicated Android engineer and are working on reducing the effect Cardiogram has on your watch's battery life. Thanks for your feedback! ^Linda

comment_Text: Extremely disappointed in the app. Soon after I purchased the premium upgrade the additional features that I paid for, were locked out. I've tried to contact the developers twice and haven't received any response. Extremely disappointed.
Reply Content: Hi Arun, I'm sorry to hear that! I've gone ahead and manually activated Premium for you so you should be good to go now. Also just wanted to let you know that we did respond on Sept. 2nd - it's possible that our response may have gotten caught in your spam filter (please consider adding us to your address book!). Hope you're staying safe! ^Linda

comment_Text: Edit: I'm using a Ticwatch E with Android Wear 2.1. Phone Android version 8.1.0. The issue is still happening. The apps Heart Rate Plus and Heart Trace are both able to auto-monitor and detect heart rates above 140 and below 50. I was excited to find this app finally working (for a long time it wouldn't open on Android 8), but it seems that the heart rate measurements are capped between 50 and 140. Every day my highest heart rate is exactly 140 and my lowest is exactly 50. I know for sure that my heart rate goes higher and lower than that daily (I have a medical condition, and see drops into the 30s and spikes into 180s and above very frequently) and other apps that can do continuous monitoring on my Android Wear watch have no trouble capturing that. So I'm not sure that this app is going to be useful for helping me to monitor my heart rate after all. It's a shame because I do like the way the info is laid out and I was looking forward to finally using it.
Reply Content: Thanks for your feedback! We don't do filtering at either 50 bpm or 140 beats. Sounds like something else might be wrong - please let us know what Android Wear device and version you're using and we can try to figure it out so you can view your information properly. You can also send your account information to hello@cardiogr.am!

comment_Text: I download this because I wanted a workaround to increase the frequency of the HR readings. Seems that if I do not keep the app open it does not do its job. The graph on the phone it shows empty spots. Suunto7 and s10+
Reply Content: Hi Marco, I'm sorry to hear that Cardiogram doesn't work as expected. Can I ask what exactly the problem is? We're always trying to improve the user experience and any feedback would be appreciated. You can reach me at linda@cardiogr.am. Thanks! ^Linda

comment_Text: complete waste of a free download. Repeats exactually the same data from your smartphone and/ or tracker. Does not provide much in new information. The calendar in the habits section remains in July. I've uninstalled and am walking away.
Reply Content:
Thanks for the feedback Samuel, could you tell me exactly what you see in the calendar? Does it open to July by default? Are you unable to adjust the month shown using the interface?

I'd love to talk about what you were hoping to see in the app in more detail! You can email me directly at song@cardiogr.am.

comment_Text: App is rather useless. Been waiting for metrics to show up for a while and nothing actually comes up. One star because the app actually boots up.
Reply Content: Hi Hector. Thanks for taking the time to leave us a review. It sounds odd that the metrics never showed up. I'm curious about what is happening as that can affect the report card. Can you send us an email to hello@cardiogram.com so we can troubleshoot together?

comment_Text: This app was a great way to have a deeper look into sleeping patterns. For the past few weeks, I could not share user data. And now this past week, it shows up with an error message on all screens. I hope this can get fixed quickly.
Reply Content: Hi Lorraine! The error message is caused by a bug that we've just deployed a fix for. Please check if you're using the latest version of Cardiogram and let me know if you're still experiencing issues. I'm not sure what's causing the sharing data issue, please email hello@cardiogr.am so we can look into this for you! ^Linda

comment_Text: I was really looking forward to using this app for my heart rate but unfortunately it does not work. I press the heart button & nothing happens. I don't know if you are in the process of fixing it or maybe have a update coming out soon. I really need a heart rate monitor & this one is compatible with my watch.
Reply Content: Hey LeeAnn! Thanks for trying Cardiogram, and sorry it didn't work. Could you email hello@cardiogr.am with the watch you're using, and the problem you're seeing, and we'll try to get everything fixed?

comment_Text: This app seems to work in spurts. It will take measurements reliably for a few days and then skip a few days for no reason I can discern. Most times when I check the app I find it has taken maybe 4 readings all day long. I also never get notified for high / low heart rates which is the entire reason I purchased the Fossil Gen 5 so I could use this app in the first place. Disappointed. UPDATE: This app is garbage. So frustrating. I'll be riding out the remainder of my subscription and cancelling.
Reply Content: Hi Thomas! Apologies for the delay. If your heart rate sampling intervals are increasing, what will help is simply opening the app more often (details here: bit.ly/3dBSrJx). For notifications, have you tried following the troubleshooting steps here: bit.ly/3g7vO1A? Please reach out to me at linda@cardiogr.am if you run into any issues. ^Linda

comment_Text: The pricing policy is an absolute disgrace! The 30-day trial period can only be activated if you sign a subscription beforehand: reportedly for $49.99/year or $6.99/month. That alone is pretty cheeky, but it is made even more so by the fact that on the next page where the subscription has to be confirmed, â‚¬59.99 or â‚¬7.99 suddenly appears, and that with a conversion rate of almost 1:1 currently !!! SO WATCHOUT BEFORE ORDERING ANYTHING!!

*Update*I understand needing to make money to do your thing, you can still make money having a free option with getting more if you subscribe. Check similar apps and you'll have what you need to keep your user base up. Making this a paid service deserves the 1 star. No reason to have to pay for something that's been free for years with no real new information being provided. Revert back to free accounts with the option to pay for those "new" features and you can have your 5 stars back.
Reply Content: Update: I definitely understand. From the support side, I'm happy to continue to advocate this for you as much as I can. Can you email me to hello@cardiogram.com, (ask for Kevin) so I can document it for my next meeting with the dev team.

comment_Text: I can't even use the app, it prompts me to sign up for an annual subscription. When I decline, it logs me out. And the report shows I'm average in every category but somehow also "worse" than average. Edit: I'm not disputing the subscription model, I'm saying the app is literally unusable. It will not let me get past the login screen.
Reply Content: Correct you won't be able to access the app unless you have an active subscription. Now, if you have an active subscription but can't get in, that is another thing. If you send us an email we can do some investigating feel free to email hello@cardiogram.com to ask for Kevin and I'll see what we can do.

comment_Text: Trying to setup my new Pixel Watch ...at no time, ever did I subscribe to or authorize a $28.00 charge for this app. Did not even know it was installed until I saw my $28.00 charge. Have requested a refund through Google. Be very careful even looking at this app.

Worked great year one. Since August 2023, App does not track unless manually pushed to do so and only records for that moment. Customer service tried to help, but un successful. Re-installed, restarted, etc., etc., All settings checked for correctness per cardiogram instructions. All good there. Still no auto record...

You went paid only?? I don't want your module. Just wanted to track my heart rate for POTS. Nevermind. Not paying for this. Goodbye, after a year. You already quit the continuous measurement sync .. why bother using it anymore if it's forced to be paid now
Reply Content: We phased out free users over the last year. This announcement and change was provided multiple times to users via in-app notifications, emails, blogs, on our website, and in the app description on the store. The subscription model supports us in maintaining the app, providing regular updates, and adding new features that our users request.

comment_Text: This company asked for the participation of people with certain medical conditions to assist with the development of their AI, which many of us were happy to do to contribute to a free service that helped others. There was no mention of them eliminating the free tier, including to those who actively participated in providing additional medical information to improve their product. I would personally avoid this company.
Reply Content: The subscription supports us in maintaining the app, providing regular updates, and adding new features that our users request. If you were a volunteer for any of our projects, you should have been granted additional free time for your contribution to the project automatically. If you did not receive it at that time, please send us a message.

comment_Text: $50 a year for a nice graph that just shows my data differently? No way that I would pay for such a limited use. ZERO functionality without subscription. Their pathetic greed will hopefully get them out of business quickly. They are f..ing liars when they claim anything can be used for free.
Reply Content: Thank you for giving us a try and for leaving some feedback. I know that the subscription may not work for some users. While it isn't required for users to use our app, we're open to any suggestions or feedback you have. Feel free to submit some feedback to us by email. We can be reached at hello@cardiogram.com

comment_Text: Shocking App I had written asking for a refund as I'm paying for a service I'm not receiving. That was ignored. This App doesn't open 3 quarters of the time. Keep your money. I don't know why the play store doesn't take it down.
Reply Content: Hi Samantha, I'm happy to look into this. I don't want you paying for something you can't use. I saw your message and it was auto-assigned to another team member who is no longer with us. I'll reach out in a moment so we can correct this. - Kevin

comment_Text: I've had this FREE app for almost 2 years now and all of a sudden can see no data without paying. as someone with chronic illness who was relying on these data points, I'm INCREDIBLY disappointed in this unnecessary cash grab.
Reply Content: We phased out free users over the last year. This announcement and change was provided multiple times to users via in-app notifications, emails, blogs, on our website, and in the app description on the store. The subscription model supports us in maintaining the app, providing regular updates, and adding new features that our users request.

comment_Text: Absolutely stupid that the integrated heart rate monitoring can't be done in a free app. This isn't a free app with in-app purchases, this is just a "free" app that ONLY works if you do a monthly subscription.
Reply Content: The app listing on Google Play only allows us to set a fixed price point or label it as free. Cardiogram does require a subscription. The subscription model supports us in maintaining the app, providing regular updates, quickly fixing bugs and issues, and developing new features that our users request. It is not a required app for your watch.

comment_Text: Despite paying for the subscription I am locked out. I've been using this app for over a year. It has recently become very inaccurate. Definitely not a service I feel is worth paying for. I've waited 6 months for a doctor's appointment with a socialist who agreed to see me on a weekend. I wasn't able to show him ANY of my data yesterday and wasted $400 to see him, because a glitch in this app that wanted me to pay AGAIN to access my data. There are much better alternatives to use.
Reply Content: April, this isn't an experience I would want for anyone. While we're not designed to replace professional medical care, we want to ensure that your data is as accurate as possible and accessible when you need it. I don't want you to pay for a subscription if it's not working. Can you send me a message at hello@cardiogram.com - Kevin

comment_Text: I used to love it but ever since a recent update I can't access it. It keeps asking me to pay for a subscription even though I already have one. It's really unfortunate because this is the app that came installed on my Fossil watch and now I can't use it.
Reply Content: Hi Dee! This isn't the experience I want for a long time Cardiogram user. Can you send us a message to hello@cardiogram.com so we can assist? If you have an active subscription right now, you should be able to click on "restore purchase" on the paywall to restore your features. Please reach out to us. - Kevin

comment_Text: You literally can't use the app without paying for the subscription... I have Fossil Gen 6 and that requires this app for some reason so only reason I have it is because of my watch and my watch keeps track of everything on its own so this app is literally not necessary. I don't understand why they don't give you ANY features without paying for it. I'd be fine if only thing I saw was heartrate and history that I already have access on my watch. Smh.
Reply Content: Paven, our partnership with Fossil ended a couple of years ago. I apologize if it came pre-installed we've tried to correct this with Fossil many times but have little power over their software. I recommend providing the feedback to Fossil so it doesn't happen to others while we also contact them. If you have questions please reach out to us.

comment_Text: Used to love this app, when it worked. Now it's just a catalyst for someone else to gather my data and I get next to nothing. Wish I had my money instead of the subscription
Nonexistent, that's the only way to describe my experience. Nothing happened, download it to the phone and watch. Did not get further than that.
It's now fully paid. There are many SaaS out there that have a free and paid component. Why not doing the same? I can't remove my data anymore as the app forces you to pay before entering. Pure scam

Get ready to receive email spam, Even if you never opted in, and even if you haven't used the app in years. I used this app a long time ago when it would simply measure your heart rate, eventually they added features for storing your previous heart rates in their cloud service, then they added a whole bunch of extra features that probably only serve to harvest your information. I stopped using it, and now more than 5 years later, they are sending me spam for their subscription "service".

I have used thus app for years to help track my heart rate for my chronic illness. Until today I was able to use without a subscription and now it won't let me log in. I've paid for a yearly one before but it's not in the budget right now and it is important for me to track my heart rate to see if I need to take more meds to help keep it stable. Now I am unable to do so. Thank you.
Reply Content: Thank you for being a Cardiogram user. Our goal is to make heart health monitoring accessible and insightful for everyone. The subscription model supports us in maintaining the app, providing regular updates, and adding new features that our users request. We've been running promos in the app recently. If you have questions please reach out to us!

comment_Text: When you sign up/log in the app will ask you to pay for a subscription, take a trial, or decline. No matter which option you choose, the app instantly sends you back to the sign up/log in page. This app is impossible to use and is scamming hundreds of people by making them pay a subscription without having access to the app.
It sucks, none of the Data on the graphs ever fill in its like it doesn't work at all. I canceled after a week it's pointless. Just shows empty graphs. Save your money

I have loved this app, and I do pay for the subscription. In recent months, there have been quite a few glitches recording my heart rate and syncing from my watch as well as syncing activities from Google Fit. I contacted Support, and while they provided various suggestions, all of which I tried, the excuse is now the "third-party apps." Sorry, I expect more from a paid app, and if you can't deliver what you advertise, then don't charge for it.

Not sure what this app does. It gives you an alert that you've got a report ready but then there's no path to the report. This is obviously a scam. Will have to report this app to the authorities as it is making a mockery of healthcare.

Developer is trying to use HR data to guess whether HRV is a marker for more severe cardiovascular conditions without even a consistency in how the data is collected. Their position is all hyperbole as the company doesn't even do their own research. They charge a subscription to make guesses about your health condition while feeding you disclaimers that this is not a medical tool that wants access to other fitness data. society needs to stop letting people sell snake oil. Alpha product at best.
Reply Content: Hi Dr Rad! Cardiogram is not meant to be a substitute for clinical exams or diagnoses. Our AI analyzes the data it is given & provides health scores by identifying similarity w/ users who have self-reported diagnoses. I'm not sure where the 20% comes from but would be happy to address your concerns - you can reach me at hello@cardiogr.am. ^Linda

comment_Text: I really want to love this app. It tracks my heart rate FAR more specifically than my Fitbit app does, which is so important for my needs. I can see every little spike and drop in my heart rate, even if it only lasts a minute. However, the app itself is glitchy, frequently will not open at all without restarting the app multiple times, and when I do get it open, there will be gaps in the data, as if I had taken my watch off, or it will refuse to refresh collected data. Not worth a subscription.

This has been marginally useful in the past but now refuses to sync with my Fitbit Versa 2 despite disconnecting and reconnecting. The app has no trouble-shooting features and there is zero support from the company even if you pay for a subscription. Overall this is a pretty poorly written piece of software. The UI is opaque, once you sign up for Premium there's no way to check on your status, the sync function is very flaky. Overall a great idea with a lot of potential very badly implemented. NOT RECOMMENDED.
Reply Content: Hi Ralph, I'm sorry to hear that you're having difficulty syncing your Fitbit with Cardiogram. I'd be happy to help you troubleshoot - you can reach me at linda@cardiogr.am. If you have a moment, I'd appreciate if you could elaborate on what you mean by the UI being opaque? We're always trying to improve our implementation. Thanks! - Linda

comment_Text: The app itself was great. I'll continue to use the free version. I paid for the premium, it never activated. I sent email to support. It's been 4 months and there has been zero response from Cardiogram support. I'm disappointed because I needed to have the ability to send data to my doctor. I've been patient, but after 4 months of no follow up, I cancelled my subscription early. I don't want to forget when that auto-renew comes along.
Reply Content: Hi Beckie, I'm sorry to hear that you weren't able to get in touch with our customer support team and understand how frustrating that must be. If you'd still like to try Premium, please reach out to me directly at linda@cardiogr.am and I can help you activate your Premium subscription. Hope you're staying safe! ^Linda

comment_Text: Really like being able to set HR monitoring to the exact minute interval, but that's about all there is to like about this app right now. Skips random intervals throughout the day for minor data blackouts on the chart. The biggest failing of this app overall is accuracy. According to Cardiogram, my heart rate NEVER exceeds 110 bpm, even though Fit and even Mobvoi tell differently. Please fix this so you can even claim basic functionality for this app.

This app is great for being able to constantly measure your heart rate and put in tabs for workouts or panic attacks and see the timeline over the day and particular hours. However $82aud for a subscription is a ridiculous price to pay. Doesn't even have a student or disability payment discount. A bit disappointing

Why did this show up in my search, for Polar H10? it does not support it ðŸ˜’ Looks like a great app for my use case, but limited support for wearables. You should look into support for chest straps too, like the Polar H10. Not manny apps out there that are great at tracking ecg and pulse over time..
Reply Content: Hi Peter, thanks for sharing your feedback! I'll let the team know of your interest in support for Polar. In the meantime, if you'd like to reach out to our team at hello@cardiogram.com, we may be able to help you find a workaround to use Cardiogram with your Polar H10, even though we aren't directly compatible. Thanks again for the feedback!

comment_Text: Got a new watch, set everything up perfectly, and now it's totally f***ed up. Nothing work. Can't get a refund either. Not the first time this has happened
Reply Content: Jeremy, this isn't the experience we want for any user, let alone a new one. I'm happy to help out. Can you message us at hello@cardiogram.com so I can partner with you? If needed, I can try to request a refund for you as well. - Kevin

comment_Text: Can't get it to sync with Samsung s22 5g 6.1 to galaxy watch 5pro? I'm paying a subscription, and Cardiogram will not sync. Galaxy wearable and Samsung s22 5g has most recent versions and updates. Unistalled and reinstalled all apps.

Installed the app because it was supposed to check for irregular heart beats. As a UK user it didn't seem to offer this service. Asked their support team but didn't hear back. User interface on phone seemed quite complex and app on watch too simple as it just showed heartbeat. If the app showed what I was after and was easy to use then this would be an easy 5 stars but, as it is, it's just another heartbeat program.

I have been using Cardiogram for awhile now- When I open the app it says 'Updating Cardiogram' and it's connected with my Fitbit/Fitbit App...and it says it's synced...but it doesn't update my information. It's not letting me see an updated version of my heart rate on the graph for the day. Super disappointed and frustrated. I have tried re-installing the app... nothing works.
Reply Content: Hi Karina, I'm sorry to hear that Cardiogram isn't working for you, that's definitely not the experience we want you to have. Have you tried following the troubleshooting steps at https://help.cardiogram.com/article/79-im-not-seeing-fitbit-data or emailing hello@cardiogr.am? Our customer support team would be more than happy to help you. ^Linda

comment_Text: Not reliable. The biggest issue I have with this app is that it displays data on my heart rate when the watch is not even being worn and is sat on a table top being charged up. It should be able to recognise when the watch is being recharged. These false readings are often really high too killing my average at rest rate and maximum rate. Not impressed.
Reply Content: Hi Alan! We recently released a fix for this issue, so you should no longer be getting readings while your watch is charging. Please let me know if that's not the case at hello@cardiogr.am. Thanks! ^Linda

comment_Text: This app is bunk. The app thinks it knows my health better than any doctor out there. Don't put your trust in an app to make assumptions of your health. I do many forms of exercise daily, and it ranks my health a 1.5. Yeah, this app is trash!
Reply Content: Hi Wesley. Thank you for taking some time to leave us some feedback. Cardiogram was not designed to replace professional medical care. Additionally, the report card feature in the app is not medically comprehensive and requires about 120 days of rolling data for a baseline. Send us a message if you're curious about that score.

comment_Text: I appreciate the idea, but the implementation is flawed. Apart from a confusing UI, it failed to read data consistently from my smart watch. It would collect a heartbeat every 6 hours, regardless of what I told my Android smartwatch to do. Sometimes it would work briefly, then go back to 6 hours. Sadly, not worth the price of free.

Seems like it has potential, but it's too messy. It didn't automatically add my sleep times at first, that fixed itself but none of my exercises are pulling through. I don't understand the point of integrating with Google Fit if it won't pull the information through. Add the badly designed UI/UX and it was uninstalled in short order
Reply Content: Hi Ben, thanks for leaving us your feedback. We appreciate you giving the app a try! If you ever want to try Cardiogram again, and you still see bugs with sleep and exercise tags, please email us at hello@cardiogr.am, and we'll look into the issue, as that doesn't sound like the normal behavior of the app. Thanks again for your perspective! - Pax

comment_Text: it barely works won't take my heart rate on command won't take it every 5 minutes as it set it goes hours without taking it when I try and make it take it it times out

Cardiogram is a great app, but suddenly removed Cardiogram Care last week without alerting its users. The help pages online still have all the information about Cardiogram Care, but no explanation as to why it was removed. This was one of the main benefits of having a Fossil watch; now that the feature is no longer available, I may make the switch back to Fitbit without using Cardiogram at all. It's a rather disappointing change of service, especially when it happened without warning.
Reply Content: Hi Gabriel! We updated the Care/Premium panels to let users know about this change several weeks ago as we believe we'll provide more value by making Cardiogram a heart rate journal companion. I'm sorry we didn't communicate this more clearly & that you felt blindsided. Please reach out to hello@cardiogr.am to discuss other ways we can help! ^Linda

comment_Text: Had it less than 24 hours and the app has crashed and won't open now. Tried uninstalling it and reinstalled it but same issue. Can't even use it on my watch now. Very disappointed considering I signed up for a paid subscription. Update: The app is finally working again but is very sluggish and slow. I was meant to get my risk report score last night but as I type this it's still not ready. Again, I am paying for this app. Happy to give more stars when this gets fixed.
Reply Content: Hi Pat! At the time you wrote this review, there was an outage of a platform that hosts Cardiogram. This was out of our control, but we got Cardiogram back online as soon as possible! We resolved lingering issues caused by the outage over the week. If you still can't see your Report, please email us at hello@cardiogram.com and we'll investigate.

comment_Text: Fitbit syncing did start working much better on 7-12-19, I went to 4 stars for now and time will tell if it keeps working. Fitbit sync went back to its erratic state today(7-15). Update 7-18, just randomly misses hours worth of data and only synced sleep data one day. Update 7-30, syncing is better, now it has synced my sleep a total of 4 times. Also wanted to add that I contacted cardiogram and got 0 response since 7-18.
Reply Content: Hi Sean - we've been making some progress, but aware the sync frequency with Fitbit can still be fairly unreliable - we're looking into it and will give another update soon!

comment_Text: The app worked for a few days, but then stopped showing my data on the Timeline. My data appears on the metrics tab though which is weird. I've created a free account, followed their Fitbit instructions, disconnected, reconnected, resynced, etc. Frustrating. It was nice while it worked.
Reply Content: Hi Meghan. Thank you for taking some time to leave us a review about this. This is something I want to look into so we can get you set up properly and troubleshoot if needed. Can you send us a message to hello@cardiogram.com so we can help?

comment_Text: They require you to enter your birthday, but the only way to do that is to swipe backwards through the months. I'm currently swiping through the 1990s 1 month at a time, and hope the app is monitoring my elevated heart rate as I complete this EXTREMELY STRESSFUL EXERCISE as I still have a ways to go.  Edit to add info requested in the comment: Fossil Sport Smartwatch, latest gen; connected to a Pixel 3 running up-to-date Android 9. I work in tech, and my husband's a sr. UX designer for an app dev company. We were both completely perplexed as to why you couldn't tab through the years in the date pickerâ€”the only way to get back to my birth year was going back through every single month between now and then.
Reply Content:
That's very surprising on Android 9! Does your date picker look like this: https://digibites.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/article_attachments/203630479/Screenshot_2016-01-19-15-37-27.png ?
If not, could you find an image that most closely resembles what you are seeing? Our app should be deferring to whatever the default date picker is on your system.

comment_Text: The app gives SLIGHTLY more insightful heart rate data than Fitbit does (it calculates resting HR more accurately, I believe), but other than that, theres no point. I've had the app for 10 days and had to relink my fitbit account 4 times just to get current data. Im just not sure why anyone with a Fitbit needs this app.
Reply Content: UPDATE: Fitbit syncing should be fixed! Contact me at song@cardiogr.am with your account email and device setup if it's still not working for you. I'd also love to hear about your experience with the app so far, and maybe the value you were hoping to see!

comment_Text: The app is pretty limited in functionality and the data visualization is not that great either- the only metrics you can see are step count and heart rate. Sleep tracking has never worked. Definitely wouldn't recommend purchasing the premium membership.

Awful interface - labelling activities is terrible, doesn't even have sleep as a category, n can't work out when I'm asleep at 3am. Minimal benefits over fitbit. Didn't detect days of rapid heartbeat / AF as anything unusual. Haven't found any practical use for anything it says. Habits are nearly a waster of time. They are all completely manual, it doesn't even recognise when I have been for a walk. More trouble than it's worth. UNINSTALLED
Reply Content: Glad to hear your feedback! We're working on everything you just named - hopefully you'll give our app another shot soon :)

comment_Text: Disappointing. After finally finding a compatible app for my Samsung galaxy 4 watch, I have been unable to sync the data at all from the last few days. After multiple attempts, reinstall and reconnect, I've not yet been able to obtain the data from my watch onto my app.
Reply Content: Hi Tamara, thanks for reaching out! The Cardiogram app is compatible with your Galaxy Watch 4; I'm sorry to hear that you had these issues getting them set up. Please send us an email at hello@cardiogr.am and we can get this fixed for you ASAP! - Pax

comment_Text: fairly poor overall. was hopeful, but seems they don't really do any analysis with the data. don't bother with the wearos app either, it's horrible. just sync with fit for the closest to functional you can get with this app
Reply Content: Hi Jared, the wearOS app should help you control the continuous recording of your heart rate - such as at different time intervals. Have you checked out the metrics panel for some analysis of information?

comment_Text: Heard about Cardiogram. Downloaded and let it get my Google Fit data (which gets data synced from a Samsung watch). The Cardiogram UI is visually messy, all over the place, and even after reading the help and clicking around, it doesn't appear to show me anything useful!? I joined the deepheart study but nothing changed in the app. So, I dont see anywhere in the app that tells me how healthy I am and if there are any warning signs. So what's the point? Samsung Health already has heart rate zones
Reply Content: Hi David, Cardiogram is a heart rate journal that allows you to easily take notes on how you're feeling and track any symptoms you may be exhibiting to help you gain a better understanding of your heart health. We also allow you to tag sections of your heart rate to show you how certain activities affect your heart rate. Hope that helps! ^Linda

comment_Text: I have used now since Garmin relationship was announced. So far it has been hit or miss, much more of the latter. Often very large discrepancies between Connect and this app in terms of metrics such as average steps per day. Although my wearable is on 24-7, see large gaps in data on the Cardiogram app, which I don't understand. I know it's an iterative, agile development but feel like it's not even alpha quality. Most importantly, not sure what insights it will provide beyond Connect. Not that I am a fan of the Garmin solutions which I have used since before wearables were introduced, since 2010, and lived through their iterations as well but I am left wondering what the goal of this app to provide something more valuable truly is?

This app is great except for one big flaw. The data it collects on my watch, and the way it presents it in the mobile app are top quality. However, it will not feed heart rate data to Google fit. (other reviews here have mentioned this, and responses suggest this is a google fit limitation, but the "heart trace 2" app, and the "marine commander" watch face can both feed this info to my Google fit account) Unfortunately, for me, that's a core feature, so I'm out.
Reply Content: Hi G Nellis, I'm sorry you feel that way! If you have a moment, I'd appreciate if you could let us know why Google Fit integration is a core feature for you - having these use cases helps us decide what features we should prioritize and focus on next. You can reach me at linda@cardiogr.am. Thanks! ^Linda

comment_Text: I really did want to love this! I was going to pay for the yearly app, however I get notifications every day that something updated or they offer you a DNA test and it doesn't work. The APp is completely faulty. If they get it fixed, it may be worth it!
Reply Content: Hi, thanks for leaving us a review with your feedback. I'm sorry to hear that you ran into these issues -- that's definitely not the expected behavior of the app. If you send us an email at hello@cardiogram.com and describe the problems you are experiencing, we will do our best to get that fixed for you and set you up for success using Cardiogram!

comment_Text: This is a cool app but it has problems. I use it in tandem with my Fitbit tracker. The main problem is that Fitbit's sensors are notoriously inaccurate and consequently Cardiogram uses this bad data to assess your health. Often times when I'm exercising my Fitbit sensors just don't work that well. You have to time the end of your exercise sessions almost impossibly precisely to get a good assessment. Very healthy guy, yet my health score was all over the place simply due to this technical error.
Reply Content: Hi Edward, thanks for leaving us a review and your feedback. The data you see in Cardiogram is data that we take directly from your wearable -- I'm sorry to hear that you aren't satisfied with the data your Fitbit is providing you! If you have any questions about the data Cardiogram uses, you can always reach out to us at hello@cardiogr.am. - Pax

comment_Text: Initially I was hopeful that this app would be useful but after having it a couple days it stopped giving daily summary information and started giving leaderboard information about noon 7/2/19. I couldn't find anything to change the display soI guess the next step is to uninstall and check the app at a later time.
Reply Content: Sorry to hear that! Could you contact song@cardiogr.am with your account and device information, and we'll try to figure out a fix?

comment_Text: Android 7.0. Latest versions of both Cardiogram and Garmin Connect. First of the day update only transfers from midnight to current time, but not from last update of previous day to midnight. Accessing Garmin Connect is now always through the website and never directly via the app (this was fixed once in February). Now the website having credentials and consent claims to go to external app. The app opens embedded in the web browser. Contacting hello@cardiogram appears useless.
Reply Content:
Hi Richard,

We moved third party authorization to browsers to make it more consistent! If it's giving you trouble, or you're not being redirected correctly, could you forward some screenshots and details?

We should also be pulling all day data from Garmin - if there are gaps, could you send some times for us to investigate?

Thanks!

comment_Text: I am totally baffled by this app.  It records my heart rate sometimes but not others, with quite random gaps during the day and a complete shut down at night! Reply Content:
Hi Howard,

We can see how that would be a frustrating experience! If you continue to have data trouble, could you contact us directly at song@cardiogr.am with your account details and an in depth description of your devices and situation for us to try to help out?

comment_Text: Background heartrate monitoring absolutely sucks. I only get about 5 readings a day. But for some reason it does work when you start a google fit workout. EDIT: Developer suggested changing the measuring frequency but this did not help

comment_Text: For looking A heart rate it's fine, I prefer the granularity over Samsung Health. We do pull data directly from your watch, so it shouldn't be inaccurate! - Pax

comment_Text: If it synced properly it would be good. The first 12 hours it sycned perfectly with my phone and watch, now it doesn't send any data across unless I repair them then I only get about an hours worth before it stops again

I like the app but the fact that it doesn't sync with Google Fit is a deal breaker for me. I don't want to have to open a bunch of different apps to get my information. comment_Text: Yet another disappointing, useless 'health' app. Cardiogram promises insightful information but delivers nothing of use. It doesn't interface or integrate with accurate HRM devices such as the Polar H7 or H10, relying on notoriously unreliable optical HRM devices. The GIGO (garbage in garbage out) rule applies to this app; it doesnt matter how good your algorithms may be if they're using garbage input data.

Reply Content: Hi Candyland8903. Definitely not how your Cardiogram app should be working especially if you're working and moving around the restaurant. Looking back, we may have already worked together on this, but if that was not you please send us a message to hello@cardiogram.com so we can do some troubleshooting with you to fix this. Thanks for reaching out!

comment_Text: Ordered the premium version for the high/low notifications. Maybe 1/4 of time I would receive a notification about am hour after the high reading. Basically worthless.

ap updated two times and no longer imports data from charge 2. it seems others have had the same problem although developer claims it was solved. app has potential if this but can be fixed. I will most certainly update my rating if it is done.

comment_Text: Granted it's only day one with the app, the bpm measuring has been 5+ min and no result, app hangs when you try to close. ** guess touch smartwatch, samsung note 10+.

comment_Text: This app has been good for tracking heart rate. But it automatically logs all my training at night as high sleeping heart rate. So now all my data is inaccurate. Fix this...

ok. using it with garmin. Sometimes the heart rate record does not show up, e.g. friday, after 2pm, no record at all although everything works and recorded fine in garmin connect. Not much insight for active sporty user, I dont get the difference between using garmin connect or this app. I was hoping for more.

Battery drain... Signed up for a free trial. The fees after are expensive considering it is one app. 41% of my battery was used by this app alone. Some good features and info but not worth the battery drain or cost.
Reply Content: Hi Sandy. Thank you for leaving us a review and for giving us a try. This isn't the experience we want for a user. Can you send a message to hello@cardiogram.com so we can troubleshoot this? If you use the app to increase the sampling rate of your watch, it uses more power. However, if you allow your watch to take samples normally, it shouldn't.

comment_Text: The app is great but the constant notification on my watch that won't go away sucks. I don't need or want a notification to tell me an app is always running/in use. Please remove this stupid notification.

comment_Text: Purchased the premium after adding to my Fossil Gen5 Carlyle HR. Cannot access all of the "premium" features. Emailed support on 9/2, tried again on 9/4. Have received no follow up. Considering requesting refund and uninstalling.
I actually love the app. I can't see my sleep data. I've installed cardiogram on both my phone and wear os watch. I don't know why I can't get my sleep data. Please!

Nearly very good but (a) halves the battery life of my TicWatch Pro and (b) seems to integrate better with Apple. Improved battery life and link to Google Fit then could be a 5* Thanks for the feedback... will keep an eye out for these changes and try again

comment_Text: does the same thing as google fit. uploads HR anywhere from 1 min to 20 min. does not keep track of HR constanly. 2 star just bcause i like how it compares your performance with ppl your age. just wished it worked as advertised.

comment_Text: it barely works won't take my heart rate on command won't take it every 5 minutes as it set it goes hours without taking it when I try and make it take it it times out

This app is great for being able to constantly measure your heart rate and put in tabs for workouts or panic attacks and see the timeline over the day and particular hours. However $82aud for a subscription is a ridiculous price to pay. Doesn't even have a student or disability payment discount. A bit disappointing

comment_Text: I really want to love this app. It tracks my heart rate FAR more specifically than my Fitbit app does, which is so important for my needs. I can see every little spike and drop in my heart rate, even if it only lasts a minute. However, the app itself is glitchy, frequently will not open at all without restarting the app multiple times, and when I do get it open, there will be gaps in the data, as if I had taken my watch off, or it will refuse to refresh collected data. Not worth a subscription.

Can't get it to sync with Samsung s22 5g 6.1 to galaxy watch 5pro? I'm paying a subscription, and Cardiogram will not sync. Galaxy wearable and Samsung s22 5g has most recent versions and updates. Unistalled and reinstalled all apps.

Why did this show up in my search, for Polar H10? it does not support it ðŸ˜’ Looks like a great app for my use case, but limited support for wearables. You should look into support for chest straps too, like the Polar H10. Not manny apps out there that are great at tracking ecg and pulse over time..
Reply Content: Hi Peter, thanks for sharing your feedback! I'll let the team know of your interest in support for Polar. In the meantime, if you'd like to reach out to our team at hello@cardiogram.com, we may be able to help you find a workaround to use Cardiogram with your Polar H10, even though we aren't directly compatible. Thanks again for the feedback!

comment_Text: This app is bunk. The app thinks it knows my health better than any doctor out there. Don't put your trust in an app to make assumptions of your health. I do many forms of exercise daily, and it ranks my health a 1.5. Yeah, this app is trash!
Reply Content: Hi Wesley. Thank you for taking some time to leave us some feedback. Cardiogram was not designed to replace professional medical care. Additionally, the report card feature in the app is not medically comprehensive and requires about 120 days of rolling data for a baseline. Send us a message if you're curious about that score.

comment_Text: They don't tell you this is a subscription only application until you have mostly created your account. This came installed on my watch, and I assumed it was the legit way to get cardio info to the phone, but I realize now it's just bloatware.
Reply Content: Hi Dusten. Thank you for taking the time to leave us a review. The app store description does mention that this app is subscription-based only. It must remain free so users can download the app and take advantage of the 30-day free trial. If you cancel before the end of your 30 days, you will not be charged :)

comment_Text: I like the app but the fact that it doesn't sync with Google Fit is a deal breaker for me. I don't want to have to open a bunch of different apps to get my information. I'll check back in the future but for now it's a no for me. If you don't use/care about Fit integration and are just looking for a heartrate monitor then it's a decent one.
Reply Content: Hi Chris, thanks for sharing your feedback. We hope to support exporting data to Google Fit in the future, but unfortunately I can't currently give you a timeline on when to expect it in the app. If you have any further questions about this, you can always reach out team at hello@cardiogram.com. Thank you again for sharing your thoughts!

comment_Text: Had it less than 24 hours and the app has crashed and won't open now. Tried uninstalling it and reinstalled it but same issue. Can't even use it on my watch now. comment_Text: The app worked for a few days, but then stopped showing my data on the Timeline. My data appears on the metrics tab though which is weird. comment_Text: I signed up for Premium but cancelled because the app constantly fails to open. I don't want to have to constantly reboot my phone when I want to look at my results in an app.

comment_Text: This is a cool app but it has problems. I use it in tandem with my Fitbit tracker. The main problem is that Fitbit's sensors are notoriously inaccurate and consequently Cardiogram uses this bad data to assess your health. Often times when I'm exercising my Fitbit sensors just don't work that well. You have to time the end of your exercise sessions almost impossibly precisely to get a good assessment. Very healthy guy, yet my health score was all over the place simply due to this technical error.
Reply Content: Hi Edward, thanks for leaving us a review and your feedback. The data you see in Cardiogram is data that we take directly from your wearable -- I'm sorry to hear that you aren't satisfied with the data your Fitbit is providing you! If you have any questions about the data Cardiogram uses, you can always reach out to us at hello@cardiogr.am. - Pax

comment_Text: For looking A heart rate it's fine, I prefer the granularity over Samsung Health. Have a hard time trusting the numbers when they give conflicting viewpoints; better HR and more active than the majority but basically dead according to the algorithm. The Samsung Health stress indicator I think is a more useful implementation of perhaps similar data.
Reply Content: Hi Mason, thanks for reaching out to Cardiogram! I'm glad that you've benefited from the granularity of the app. If you have questions about accuracy, please reach out to us at hello@cardiogr.am, and we can take a look at your data to see if anything is amiss. We do pull data directly from your watch, so it shouldn't be inaccurate! - Pax
